https://prez.dev/description.@value: A categorization of disciplines or topics that the broad field of Earth science can be subdivided into, i.e. a listing of the Fields of Research, or subjects, to which a geoscience dataset, publication, observation/activity, or entity pertains. The vocabulary also contains relevant disciplines that intersect with the various Earth science fields, such as biological sciences and built environment and design, as well as entries related to collection and heritage management. Notations included are those from the 2020 ANZSRC listing (see History Note) or in common use in the geoscience community.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: The interdisciplinary study of biology and geology, embracing interactions between the Earth's biosphere and geosphere (i.e. lithosphere, hydrosphere, atmosphere and cryosphere). It encompasses the biological aspects of geology, e.g. systematic paleontology, the study of organically influenced sedimentation, or the identification of a concealed rock unit by the type of plant growing at the surface above it.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value:
Definition adapted from:
1) Glossary of geology (5th edition revised; Neuendorf et. al., 2011)
2) Yin, H, Xie, S, Qing, J, Yan, J and Luo, G 2008, Discussion on geobiology, biogeology and geobiofacies: Sci. China Ser. D-Earth Sci., v. 51, p. 1516â€“1524, doi:10.1007/s11430-008-0120-6.

https://prez.dev/description.@value: The interdisciplinary study of biology and geology, embracing interactions between the Earth's biosphere and geosphere (i.e. lithosphere, hydrosphere, atmosphere and cryosphere). It encompasses the biological aspects of geology, e.g. systematic paleontology, the study of organically influenced sedimentation, or the identification of a concealed rock unit by the type of plant growing at the surface above it.
